Arena Challenge is a Guild exclusive event where players engage in Anytime PVP fights to earn Arena Points and Rewards!

 - Win Anytime PVP fights to earn Arena Points. If you lose the fight, you will lose Arena Points.
 - Your Defensive Formation will also win and lose points throughout the event.
 - The Top Guild will be listed as the Arena Champion in the PVP menu for ALL players to see!

이 병원은 이미 예전부터 제국의 의료법을 위반하여 문을 닫아야 마땅하나 아직 이 병원만큼 확실하게 치료해주는 곳이 없어서 아직도 널리 사랑받고 있습니다.
감염 테스트 시설은 질병과 고뇌 그리고 의사 결정의 고통에서 벗어날 좀비가 되게 도와 드립니다. 다만 한번 변하면 돌이킬 수 없으니 주의를 필요로 합니다.
전투 깃발은 다른 플레이어와의 전투를 원할 때 사용할 수 있습니다. 해적 깃발을 들고 다른 플레이어를 공격하면 큰 보상을 받을 수 있습니다. 하지만 다른 플레이어도 당신을 공격할 수 있다는 걸 잊지 마세요. 다른 플레이어와의 싸움을 원치 않으면 제국의 깃발을 들면 됩니다.
정체를 알 수 없는 기술이군요. 어떻게 사용하는지 너무 깊게 생각하지 마시고 - 그냥 쓰세요.
Have you ever wondered how your favorite formation would stack up against another living opponent? Find out now! Set up your army and let others battle it! Get rewards and that sweet street cred!
자원 수송시설은 당신의 운반 트럭을 관리하며, 근처의 탄광이나 채석장에서 자원을 채취해 옵니다. 자원 수송시설은 지정된 장소에서만 쓸 수 있으니, 멀리 떨어진 곳의 자원을 채취하려고 확장을 하시려면, 그 근방에 수송시설을 지으세요.
배급소는 수도에 있는 제국의 최고 사령부가 물품을 보내주는 곳입니다. 조금만 더 자주 보내주었으면 좋겠는데요.
보강된 콘크리트 벽과 최고의 제국 보안 기술로 만들어진 이곳을 보통 사람들은 돈이나 금을 보관하는 장소로 생각하죠. 하지만 이 안에는 아주 위험하고 휠씬 소중한 것이 있습니다.
고급 창고에는 2000개의 자원을 보관할 수 있습니다. 첨단 기술로 인해 단 4명의 일꾼으로 모든일을 소화할 수 있습니다! 더 좋은점은 건물의 대부분이 땅 아래에 있기 때문에 땅위에 더많은 공간을 확보할 수 있습니다. 고급 창고는 지하에 있었기 때문에 처음 들어 보셨을 것입니다 .
대규모 창고는 1500개의 자원을 보관할 수 있습니다. 어떻게 적은 인원으로 더 많은 물품을 소화할 수 있을까요? 간단하죠. 모든 안전수칙과 업무현장의 사고들은 무시해버리면 됩니다.
중규모 창고는 1000개의 자원을 보관할 수 있습니다. 똑같은 인원으로 어떻게 더 많은 자원을 얻을 수 있을까요? 당연히 무보수 야근 덕분이죠.
소규모 창고는 500개의 자원을 보관할 수 있습니다. 여러 개를 지으시면 편하게 쉬면서 운반 트럭이 창고에 운반하는 것을 지켜보기만 하시면 됩니다!
유닛의 감염상태는 영구적으로 지속됩니다. 정말 감염시키시겠습니까?

우리 군의 사기를 올리는 데는 적군의 해골을 보여주는 것이 최고입니다.
이곳은 겐타스가 레이더스의 모든 총기에 사용되는 화약을 저장하는 곳입니다.

농장 근처에 지으면 +5% XP 농작물 보너스를 받을 수 있습니다.
제한: 빌딩 당 1개

물을 저장할 수 있는 해결책으로 인해 더 빠르게 맛있는 농작물을 키울 수 있습니다.
레이더스들은 그들의 전투 매머드를 마굿간에 쳐박아 놓습니다. 자유를 외치는 그들의 구슬픈 울음소리는 아주 먼 곳에서도 들을 수 있습니다. 키이이이-톡-톡-푸-타아왕아앙! 이렇게 말이지요.
반군지도자 겐타스는 여기서 하루종일 운동을 하며 멋진 근육을 뽐냅니다. 하지만 그의 추종자들이 어떻게 그런 새다리로 제대로 설 수 있냐고 물으면, 그는 그들을 갯지렁이의 먹잇감으로 만들어 버리죠.

자원수집에 +16% 보너스
제한: 1

일꾼들은 생동감 넘치는 랩터스 동상을 보면서 더욱더 열심히 일하게 될 것입니다.
이 돌은 부서지기 쉬운 돌입니다. 땅에 묻으면 악기처럼 소리가 나면서 즉흥 연주회가 펼쳐집니다. 돌이 조심스럽게 움직이는것은 쉽게 부서지는 자신을 보호하기 위해서 랍니다.
실험 모델 17호를 격퇴하고 얻은 녹슨 트로피 입니다. 레이더스의 해골은 아니지만 우리 군의 파괴력을 확실히 증명해줄 수 있는 물건입니다.
홍수나 총기 규제등의 문제를 아주 저렴하게  해결할 수 있습니다. 하지만 멋져보이지는 않는군요.
모래주머니는 전초기지에서 허수아비 같은 역활을 합니다. 원래는 원주민들을 겁주기 위해 설치했지만, 그들이 모래주머니 따위로 겁먹을 리가 없잖아요. 그냥 장식품이 되어 버렸네요!

주택 근처에 지으시면 +6%의 금과 XP 보너스를 받습니다!

언젠가는 우리의 방송을 듣는 청취자가 생길 것입니다.
조이가 상상할 수 있는 가장 무서운 모습을 하고 있습니다. 이것은 좀비를 퇴치하기 위해 만들어졌습니다. (감염 기간에만 지을 수 있습니다.)

상점 근처에 지으시면 +20%의 XP 보너스를 받습니다!

내 산산조각난 기념비를 볼지어다.
장엄하고, 절망적인…
동맹군에게 정확한 적의 위치를 알려주거나, 적을  우리군의 매복 지점까지 유인하십시오.

상점에 +4%의 금과 +9%의 XP 보너스를 받습니다. 

유일하게 멀리서도 보이는 밝게 반짝이는 빛이니만큼, 황량한 사막에서 한 줄기의 희망이 될 것입니다.
모두에게 도움을 요청하십시오. 물론 적들에게도 당신의 위기가 알려질 것입니다.
점령당하기는 싫지만 맞서 대항할 처지가 안되시나요? 본진에 이 점령 금지 푯말을 꽂아 놓으세요.

상점이나 주택 근처에 지으시면 +20%의 금 보너스를 받습니다.
제한: 건물당 1개씩

이 고대의 동상은 황실이 존재하기 전부터 있었습니다. 아무도 이것이 누구인지 모르지만, 분명한 건 그에게 발톱관리가 필요하다는 것이죠.
황제가 우리 곁에 있다면 누가 우리를 공격할 수 있을까요? 참고로 그는 어떠한 공격에도 전혀 방어를 하지 않습니다.
배틀 네이션스의 전투마스크를 기념하세요. 당신의 군인들이 매우 좋아할 거예요.

상점이나 주택 근처에 지으시면 +20%의 금 보너스를 받습니다.
제한: 건물당 1개씩

이 고대의 동상은 황실이 존재하기 전부터 있었습니다. 아무도 이것이 누구인지 모르지만, 분명한 건 그에게 발톱관리가 필요하다는 것이죠.

상점이나 주택 근처에 지으시면 +15%의 금 보너스를 받습니다.
제한: 건물당 1개

금화를 던져서 소원을 빌면, 소원이 이루어질 거예요. 당신의 소원이 이루어지는 게 아니라, 제 소원이 이루어진다고요. 전 항상 제 소유의 대륙을 가지고 싶었어요.

상점이나 주택 근처에 지으시면 +15%의 금 보너스를 받습니다!
제한: 건물 당 1개씩

이 분수대에 앉아서 물이 떨어지는 소리를 들으면 근심걱정이 사라집니다. 마음이 편해지면서 화장실로 뛰어가게 되죠.

새해 각오 미션을 완료하고 상을 받으세요!
독재자가 된다는 것은 힘과 성과를 얻고, 엄청난 부담을 이겨낸다는 뜻입니다. 세상을 어깨에 짊어진  거나 마찬가지지요, 대장님.
숲은 군인들을 행복하게 해준다고 과학적으로 입증이 되었다고 하네요. 말도 안되는 이야기 같지만 그래도 기지 주변에 나무를 좀 심는 것도 괜찮을 듯 싶네요.
죽은것들로 주위를 둘러싸서 당신의 감성을 만족시키세요.
쭈그려 앉아 있는 이 못생기고 짤막한 나무는 자신의 생김새에 매우 만족합니다. 이러한 자신감은 장식 메뉴에서 더욱 잘 나타나고 있습니다, 이것이야말로 진정한 스따~일, 전통적인 아름다움에 도전하는 자세입니다.
까칠까칠하고 못생긴 나무들. 하지만 누군가에게는 사랑을 받아야 합니다. 사랑을 줄 사람... 혹시 당신이 아닐까요?
가끔 나무를 기르고 싶어지죠. 한편 가끔은 조경을 위해 나무를 다 잘라내 그루터기를 만드는 냉혹한 짓을 하기도 하죠.
오랜 시간 동안 홍보를 하면, 운 좋게 대박 음반처럼 터질 수 있지 않을까요.
참나무 숙성 셰리와인 마셔본 적 있어요? 기가 막히던데.
대부분의 오리나무 꽃은 봄에 피지만 이것은 아닙니다.
향나무에서 나는 향기야말로 바로 당신이 원하던 발내음. 신발에 쏘옥 넣어두세요. 정말 멋잇네요!
상록수의 칩엽을 빻아서 가루를 만들면, 거기서 지독한 냄새가 나요. 상록수에는 독이 없는게 맞죠?
단풍나무만 있으면 뜨겁고 차가운 메이플시럽을 가질 수 있습니다. 아차, 그게 차가운것만 되네요.. 괜히 기대하게 해서 미안합니다.

아름다운 버드나무 입니다.

주의: 진짜 버드나무가 아닙니다. 인조, 독극성 재료로 제작되었습니다.
좋은 울타리가 좋은 이웃을 만든다면, 이 벽은 당신에게 최고의 이웃을 만들어줍니다.

농장 근처에 지으시면 +15%의 XP 보너스를 받습니다
제한: 건물당 관개 장식 1개씩

이 황량한 땅에 하나의 등대같은 희망입니다. 지으세요, 그럼 그들이 올 것입니다. 목마른 사람들이요.
Standard equipment for any settlement near a beach. This item serves double-duty, dispelling large waves and keeping enemy attack craft from beaching.

인구수를 현재보다 더 낮게 설정할 수 없습니다. 
인구수를 조정하고 다시 시도하세요.
이곳에서 일을 하면 XP와 금을 획득할 수 있습니다.
배틀 네이션스는 iPhone,iPad,iPod touch에서 지원되는 장대한 제국 건설 게임입니다. http://bit.ly/BattleNations
직업 메뉴에서는 건물을 수정할 수 없습니다.
대상 플레이어는 현재 진급시킬 수 없습니다.
이 플레이어를 해당 랭크로 진급/강등할 권한이 없습니다.
진급/강등하려는 플레이어가 현재 당신의 길드에 소속되어 있지 않습니다.
실버 울프의 과학자 보겔 박사가 이끄는 군대가 당신의 전초기지에서 보스 습격 미션에 착수했습니다. 길드원과 힘을 합쳐 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 받으세요.
겐타스와 3명의 반군지도자의 말에 의하면 차량은 보스 습격 미션에 투입될 수 없습니다. 금속 탐지기를 무사히 통과해야 합니다. 길드원들과 함께 전투에 참가하고 특별 보상을 받으세요.
반란군의 차량과 방어 전문가 러들로 병장이 당신의 전초기지에서 보스 습격 미션에 착수했습니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 그들에 대항하십시오. 더 많은 무리를 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 특별 비행 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.
랩터스 트레이너 유즐은 당신 기지의 두 번째 보스 습격 미션을 위해 사나운 짐승들을 선발했습니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 그들에 대항하십시오. 더 많은 무리를 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 특별 비행 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.
반군 지도자 겐타스가 자신의 힘을 보여주기 위해 잠시 귀환하였습니다. 그는 무시무시한 보스 습격 미션 베타 작전으로 공격할 것입니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 그들에 대항하십시오. 더 많은 무리를 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다. 레인보우 유니콘 기병대를 얻을 유일한 기회입니다!
실버 울프의 과학자 보겔 박사가 이끄는 군대가 당신의 전초기지에서 보스 습격 미션에 착수했습니다.  길드원과 팀을 구성하여 그들에 대항하십시오. 더 많은 무리를 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 특별 상공 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.
겐타스와 3명의 반군지도자의 말에 의하면 차량은 보스 습격 미션에 투입될 수 없습니다. 금속 탐지기를 무사히 통과해야 합니다. 더 많은 적의 무리를 물리칠수록 공중 유닛을 포함한 특별 보상을 더 많이 받을 수 있습니다.

The infected have returned and this time they've brought a deadly plague with them! Don't breathe the air! The more waves of enemies you defeat, the more prizes you and your guild will earn, including exclusive units.

Did the Rebels get boats? No! The Sovereign Navy has ground forces and they want to fight! The more waves of enemies you defeat, the more prizes you and your guild will earn, including exclusive units.

Yuzul the Raptor Trainer and his beasts of war are looking for a fight! And this time they're looking to burn you. Team up with your guildmates to battle them. The more waves of enemies you defeat, the more prizes you and your guild will earn, including exclusive flying units.
레이더스의 주술사 쿠로스의 군대가 당신의 전초기지로 향하고 있습니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 그들에 대항하십시오. 더 많은 무리를 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 특별 비행 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.
레이더스의 주술사 쿠로스의 군대가 당신의 전초기지에 또 한 번의 보스 습격 미션에 착수했습니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 그들에 대항하십시오. 더 많은 무리를 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 특별 비행 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.
반란군의 차량과 방어 전문가 러들로 병장이 당신의 전초기지에서 보스 습격 미션에 착수했습니다. 길드원과 힘을 합쳐 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 받으세요.
반란군의 전략 요원 도리안 소위가 당신의 전초기지에 보스 습격 미션에 착수했습니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 그들에 대항하십시오. 더 많은 무리를 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 특별 비행 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.

The rebels have issued a combat challenge! And they chose a terrible location for it. It's possible the ground here is not entirely stable. The more waves of enemies you defeat, the more prizes you and your guild will earn, including exclusive units.
반란군 조종사 에발린 에이스하트가 당신의 전초기지에서 반란군 두 번째 보스 습격 미션을 위해 복수의 침공을 시작했습니다. 길드원들과 모여 그들에 대항하세요. 더 많은 적의 무리를 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 직접 선택한 특별 비행 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.

The Silver Wolves are back for some cold vengeance and they've somehow managed to convince some Sovereign and Reef Bandits to join them. The more waves of enemies you defeat, the more prizes you and your guild will earn, including exclusive units.
실버 울프들은 더 견고한 방어 시스템을 갖추고 유리한 지역에서 싸우길 원하고 있습니다. 더 많은 웨이브의 적들을 물리칠수록 당신과 당신의 길드는 특수 유닛을 비롯한 많은 상품을 얻을 수 있습니다.
실버 울프 집행자 스로우가 당신의 전초기지에서 보스 습격 미션에 착수하였습니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 그들에 대항하십시오. 더 많은 무리를 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 특별 비행 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.
실버 울프 집행자 스로우가 더 많은 지원병과 함께 두 번째 보스 습격 미션에 대한 복수를 하기 위해 돌아왔습니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 대항하세요. 더 많은 적의 무리들을 물리칠수록  당신과 길드는 특별 비행 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.
감염된 부대가 당신의 전초기지에 도착했습니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 대항하세요. 더 많은 적의 무리들을 물리칠수록 당신과 길드는 특별 비행 유닛을 포함한 더 많은 보상을 받게 됩니다.
랩터스 트레이너 유즐은 당신 기지의 두번째 보스 습격 미션을 위해 사나운 짐승들을 선발했습니다. 길드원과 팀을 구성하여 그들에 대항하십시오. 길드원과 힘을 합쳐 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 받으세요.
반군 지도자 겐타스가 보스 자리를 침범했습니다. 그의 군대를 물리쳐 보상을 받으세요. 이제껏 한번도 등장하지 않았던 유니콘 기병대를 얻을 기회입니다!
The infected have returned and this time they've brought a deadly plague with them! Don't breathe the air! Battle their forces with your guild to earn exclusive prizes.
Did the Rebels get boats? No! The Sovereign Navy has ground forces and they want to fight! Battle their forces with your guild to earn exclusive prizes.
Yuzul the Raptor Trainer and his beasts are looking for a fight! The more waves of enemies you defeat, the more prizes you and your guild will earn, including exclusive flying units.
레이더스의 주술사 쿠로스의 군대가 당신의 전초기지를 곧 공격할 것입니다. 길드원과 힘을 합쳐 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 받으세요.
레이더스의 주술사 쿠로스의 군대가 당신의 전초기지에 또 한번의 보스 습격 미션에 착수했습니다. 길드원과 힘을 합쳐 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 받으세요.
반란군 전략 요원인 도리안 소위가 당신의 전초기지를 습격하기 시작했습니다. 길드원과 힘을 합쳐 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 받으세요.

The rebels have issued a combat challenge! And they chose a terrible location for it. It's possible the ground here is not entirely stable. Battle their forces with your guild to earn exclusive prizes.
반란군 조종사 에발린 에이스하트가 당신의 전초기지에서 반란군 두 번째 보스 습격 미션을 위해 복수의 침공을 시작했습니다. 길드원과 힘을 합쳐 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 받으세요.
The Silver Wolves are back for some cold vengeance and they've somehow managed to convince some Sovereign and Reef Bandits to join them. Battle their forces with your guild to earn exclusive prizes.
실버 울프들은 자신들에게 유리한 고지에서 우리와 싸우려고 작전을 짜는 것 같습니다. 아마도 저희는 불리한 지역에서 싸움을 벌이게 될 것입니다. 당신의 길드를 이끌고 저들을 물리쳐 특별 상품을 얻으십시오.
실버 울프 집행자 스로우가 당신의 전초기지에서 보스 습격 미션에 착수했습니다. 길드원과 힘을 합쳐 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 받으세요.
실버 울프 집행자 스로우가 두 번째 보스 습격 미션에 대한 복수를 하기 위해 돌아왔습니다.  길드원과 함께 힘을 합쳐 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 얻으세요.
감염된 부대가 도착했습니다. 길드원과 함께 감염군을 무찌르고 특별한 보상을 얻으세요.
이 무기는 탄약이 충분히 없어서 기능을 제대로 발휘할 수 없습니다.

더 많은 자원을 소지할 수 없습니다!
점령지에서 철수하시겠습니까?
Earn 10 Nanopods for every friend that completes the tutorial.
친구들을 공격해서 자원을 얻어보세요! 그리고 잿더미로 변한 그들의 전초기지 앞에서 춤을 추세요!
배틀 네이션스는 친구들과 함께하면 더욱더 재미있습니다.
길드 해제를 하려면 길드 메뉴 수정하기로 가세요.
골리앗 탱크를 공격하려면 맨 앞줄을 조준해야 합니다.
길드를 탈퇴하기 전에 다른 사람를 리더로 세워야 합니다.
길드 이름에 사용할 수 없는 문자입니다.
Not enough money in the guild bank to hurry this item.
Not enough money in the guild bank to buy this item.
There is no item to collect!
길드 태그에 잘못된 문자가 삽입되어 있습니다
Oh noes, you're out of gvg energy!
Oh noes, you're out of nanopods!
인구수를 더 이상 증가시킬 수 없습니다. 레벨을 올려서 인구 최대치를 증가시키세요.
부상당한 유닛을 감염시키면 좀비 부대를 얻게 될 수도 있습니다! 좋은 유닛일수록 더 좋은 좀비를 얻게 됩니다!
당신의 소속 길드는 상위권이었지만 40위 안에는 들지 못했습니다. 다음번에는 더 좋아지겠죠!
다음 침공 이벤트를 기다리며, 점령할 준비를 하십시오! 아무리 철저히 준비해도 모자라지 않습니다.
다음 침공 이벤트에 참가하려면 길드에 가입하십시오.
받은 초대 중 하나를 수락 하거나
Our vehicles can't navigate through this dense jungle. Troops and planes only.
영토 확장이 진행 중엔 다른 영토 확장을 할 수 없습니다. 진행 중인 영토 확장을 서두르시겠습니까?
배틀 네이션스는 iPhone,iPad,iPod touch에서 지원되는 장대한 제국 건설 게임입니다. http://bit.ly/BattleNations
지금 막 배틀 네이션스에서 레벨 $level이 되었습니다!
애쉬 장군은 적군으로 귀순했다. 그후로 전쟁은 더 격화되었다.
전초기지는 카리스톤에서 북서쪽으로 3,529마일 떨어져 있다. 그곳은 제국 영토 북쪽 가장자리에 위치해 있다.
제95소총부대는 극비계획에 필요한 우라늄 광석을 찾기 위해 북쪽으로 향하는데....
램지 병장: 최고 중의 최고. 고양이 애호가
조이: 천재 기계공. 그저 여기에 있는 것만으로도 행복하다.
잘하셨습니다. 보안에 대한 요구가 많아질 때까지 보상이 한동안 감소합니다. 다른 요구사항도 들어주시면 많은 보상을 얻으실 수 있습니다.
잘하셨습니다. 주류에 대한 요구가 많아질 때까지 보상이 한동안 감소합니다. 다른 요구사항도 들어주시면 많은 보상을 얻으실 수 있습니다.
Great work, you satisfied the Demand for Mission Jobs!  Mr. Purrface is impressed.
잘하셨습니다. 식량에 대한 요구가 많아질 때까지 보상이 한동안 감소합니다. 다른 요구사항도 들어주시면 많은 보상을 얻으실 수 있습니다.
잘하셨습니다. 아이템에 대한 요구가 많아질 때까지 보상이 한동안 감소합니다. 다른 요구사항도 들어주시면 많은 보상을 얻으실 수 있습니다.
잘하셨습니다. 육류에 대한 요구가 많아질 때까지 보상이 한동안 감소합니다. 다른 요구사항도 들어주시면 많은 보상을 얻으실 수 있습니다.
잘하셨습니다. 양념에 대한 요구가 많아질 때까지 보상이 한동안 감소합니다. 다른 요구사항도 들어주시면 많은 보상을 얻으실 수 있습니다.
잘하셨습니다. 연장에 대한 요구가 많아질 때까지 보상이 한동안 감소합니다. 다른 요구사항도 들어주시면 많은 보상을 얻으실 수 있습니다.
프론티어 가장자리에 위치한 이곳은 제국에서 제일 멀리 떨어진 곳입니다.
마린은 최북단에 있는 제국의 국경 도시였지만, 급속하게 성장하여 독립 도시가 되었습니다. 반란군과 남쪽에서 일어나는 전쟁에서 독립적인 곳이고 여유 있는 많은 시민은 이곳에 별장을 두고 여름마다 멋진 절경을 즐기고 있습니다.
현 레벨에서는 이미 최대 수의 일꾼을 소유하고 있습니다.
우리가 먼저 공격합니다. 우리 탱크가 이미 선택된 것이 보이는군요. 이제 방패를 들고 있는 반란군을 선택하면 우리 탱크가 사격할 것입니다!
우리가 먼저 공격합니다. 우리 탱크가 이미 선택된 것이 보이는군요. 이제 방패를 들고 있는 반란군을 선택하면 우리 탱크가 사격할 것입니다!
우리가 먼저 공격합니다. 우리 탱크가 이미 선택된 것이 보이는군요. 이제 방패를 들고 있는 반란군을 선택하면 우리 탱크가 사격할 것입니다!
이번엔 고급 포병으로 공격해 보겠습니다. 고급 포병은 한번에 여러 명의 적군을 공격할 수 있습니다! 고급 포병을 클릭하세요.
고급 포병은 앞줄에 위치한 적군과 뒷줄에 있는 대포 트럭을 공격할 수 있다고 보여 주는군요! 앞줄을 클릭하셔서 공격하세요!
헉! 탱크와 소총은 사선을 뚫지 못합니다. 하지만 포병대는 머리위로 사격이 가능합니다. 포병대를 클릭하세요.
과녁 표시는 포병대가 어디를 조준하는지 보여줍니다. 명사수를 클릭하세요.
Hello there Ramsey! I'm off to go try some fishing at the Reef Bandit fishing grounds. Care to join me?
I don't know, Floyd. I'm really only interested in hunting animals that can provide a little thrill. Fishing isn't the most exciting hobby.
Oh no, that's where you're wrong! The excitement of the stationary hunter! Waiting and waiting and waiting for your opponent to strike! You have to make it thrilling.
Hmm, that gives me an idea… Sure. I'll go with you.
Just let me get my supplies.
Oh we shall see, my friend!
I'm not seeing a fishing rod, Ramsey. Is it collapsible? I've got the latest in rods. The Cast-Master 350. I'll be hauling in fish so fast. You wait and see.
I'm not using a rod. I'm using an old Ramsey family method from way back. I'll definitely catch some fish.
The uh "locals" don't seem to be too happy about your preferred fishing method, Ramsey. In fact, I'd say they look very upset. Downright murderous.
It's fine, Floyd. If they have a problem with it, they can say so.
They're coming this way. I think things are about to get ugly!
Can't a man even fish in peace anymore?
You were literally scooping them, because they were dead.
Well, that was a waste. Not only did we get into a fight, but I wasn't able to catch anything! There must have been too much noise scaring the fish away, Ramsey.
I don't know what you're talking about Floyd. Did you see how many fish I pulled in? I was practically scooping them off the surface.
Well Ramsey, this whole expedition has been an utter failure for me. Let's go home.
Sure Floyd. I don't think I could carry anymore fish even if I wanted to.
Can I carry one, at least?
Ramsey, you must be some sort of expert fishermen. Look at that haul! Ha! And Floyd! Where are all your fish? You're terrible.
Had I realized we were allowed to use… unconventional methods this would be a different story altogether. Sergeant Boom Boom over here scared away all the fish.
Yeah, I scared them right into my net! Now who wants to have some fresh caught fried fish?
He really is. Much better than Floyd.
What about me? I was the catalyst for this entire situation!
This is delicious. Well done Sergeant.
Yeah Ramsey. You'll have to share your fishing secrets with me.

Perkins, it's a wonderful day. The sun is out with zero clouds, the temperature is comfortable, and I have a delicious burrito. I'd appreciate not being bothered with trivial issues like "invaders" or "besieged townsfolk"—
But sir! There are ships off shore and they're fighting each other!
Oh Cool! War ships! Why didn't you tell me earlier?
Oh well, back to my relaxing day. Where's my burrito?
I didn't recognize the symbols from those ships. It looked like the attackers had the same symbol as the ships they were attacking.
Definitely in-fighting, sir. Or the ship had been hijacked by pirates. Or it was a ghost ship.
So, definitely one thing, or something completely different. That's super helpful, thanks Sergeant.
Floyd sir? I know Lt. Morgan said to look for survivors but I'm not seeing anything yet.
Over here Perkins! It would seem that I've found a man.
A man in need of serious and timely medical care. I suppose the hospital at the Outpost will have to do. Oh look another one, and another...
So Floyd, did those half-dead guys you and Perkins found on the beach say anything important I should know about? I bet they're from one of those boats.

They all claim to be former members of the Sovereign Navy, led by a Captain Pike, Morgan. Captain Pike insists that they were on their way here to ask for our help. Apparently many lives are at stake, including our own.
Oh, is that it? I thought it was going to be something ominous.
Alright Pike, we got a bunch of repair supplies together to help patch up your fleet. This better not be a scam because Perkins doesn't have any money.
Lieutenant Morgan, correct? I appreciate the aid. Had it not been for your top engineer 'Floyd' and your medical facilities, my men and I would be dead now.

Whoa, whoa, whoa... First, Floyd is a Civil Engineer, so that barely even counts. Second, we're helping you only because apparently our lives are at stake and I am a fan of living. We don't even know where you guys came from.
I'll answer all of your questions in due time.
I quickly rose to the rank of Captain in the Sovereign Navy, but the constant expansion of our home coupled with the ceaseless murder of indigenous peoples took its toll.
My men and I fled and created a colony west of here. The Sovereign Navy has only recently come looking for us. As I suspected, they want this entire continent for their own purposes.
Wait, the whole continent? This one's claimed, pal. What's wrong with the one you came from?

Ours is less than half the size. As you can probably imagine, we've run out of room and need to expand. The monarchy has chosen this land as their own. You can expect more Sovereign ships to be coming.
I volunteer the remainder of my fleet to protect the outlying waters until you can construct your own ships.
I'm used to being the one snuffing out other cultures...
I'm getting tired of this Pike.
Wow sir! The way you took out those ships was pretty impressive!
Those poor bastards didn't stand a chance. I literally wrote the manuals they were using. Now that the battle is over, we drink! Fetch me some rum from the hold.
Oh sure! Why don't you take this drink I was going to give to Lt. Morgan. It's whiskey on ice though. I hope that's not a problem.
I shall make due, but keep in mind that a true beverage aficionado needs nothing in his glass to lessen the true body and flavor of his spirits.
Hey! That's my drink! What the hell, Perkins?!
Well Lieutenant, I think it's about time you Imperials were introduced to the larger world. You need to literally expand your horizons.
At the same time, I need to be getting back to the rest of my men with the supplies you put together for me. This is a perfect opportunity to do both.
Oh, you're finally leaving? That's too bad, really. Your knowledge has been invaluable while we blah, blah, blah—
Perkins! Ramsey! Get the ships ready! We're going on a field trip.
Can I get you a rum for the road, Captain Pike?
Ships incoming Lieutenant. They don't look friendly either.
Who the hell are those guys? And why do their ships look like cobbled together pleasure craft? Are we going water-skiing and pillaging?
Ah, I figured this encounter was just a matter of time. We call them Reef Bandits and your Sergeant is correct about them not being friendly.
Man your battlestations everyone! Things are about to get rough!
Eventually you must face the monster you created.
Water, water everywhere. Let's go have a drink.
Well, that wasn't so bad? So, they're what, the Raiders of the sea or something?
Not quite. I'll explain in more detail later. Let's keep moving lest we get attacked again in open water.
Alright Pike, your colony is in sight. We should dock quickly before we get attacked again.
There should be plenty of space for your ships. Once docked, I'll have my men serve refreshments, and I'll shed some more light on our current situation.
That's kind of sad. Well, let's go home now.
Now that everyone has been refreshed, let me introduce our translator Karin Winters. She's brilliant with language and she'll figure out that Reef Bandit jargon soon enough.

Thank you, Captain. I've been fascinated by language for as long as I can remember, but these Reef Bandits are tough to figure out. They're actually the main reason why Captain Pike and the rest of us decided to defect.
They used to inhabit the many smaller islands all through this area, but Sovereign actions forced them from their peaceful homes. They scavenge because they must to survive.
Do not mistake them as being simple or unsophisticated, it will be the last mistake you make. And know that they will attack you if they think you are Sovereign.
So Pike, you say a huge fleet is moving toward the Outpost? How do we know if this information is accurate?

That's why I came up here. I don't want to mobilize our fleets for nothing. We need some way of seeing things that are a great distance away. You Imperials have some impressive technology. Any thoughts?
Yes, actually! We call it RADAR and it essentially beams out pulses of radio waves which bounce off of objects then return to the radar station.
We can get started on some radar dishes right away!
Wait, do we need a self-destruct button for these?
I know the perfect place to set these up.
Fascinating designs Floyd. And you say this works over long ranges?
Well, yes, within reason at least. As long as there's nothing large in the way, like say a mountain, the signal will travel for miles.
Those islands there? The ones with the not-so-friendly-looking animals on them?
Yes Lieutenant, those islands are the perfect place to set up these radar stations. Unfortunately the "local inhabitants" are not very welcoming.
I guess we could have another barbeque after this.
Whoa there. Easy on the Floyd praise.
Animal inhabitants removed and radar dishes set up and functional. We'll be able to see any potential enemies far before they see us.
Excellent! You've once again proven your value, Floyd! What would we do without you?
I tried to check on your radar set up when we got back but it's dead. No signal. Nothing.
That doesn't make any sense. I installed multiple backup power batteries. The only way they would cease to function is with tampering. We need to go see what happened to them.
It's not going to be easy, I can tell you. My men noticed the signal had cut out as well so we stopped by to investigate on our way up here. Ships and mines are blocking each of the islands.
Sounds like someone doesn't want us to see what's coming.
Anyone else have an impending feeling of doom?
That takes care of the blockade. And I think I can see why the radar isn't working. Someone broke it. Floyd?
We'll need to return to the Outpost so I can gather materials. It looks like we should be able to salvage most of the current stations.
Alright folks. Let's get this agenda hashed out. We have two major issues at the moment. The first of which is getting those radar stations back online so we can see incoming threats.
I'm on it, LT! Floyd brought me up to speed on the innards of those contraptions. I got some repair kits ready to be built that'll fix 'em right up.

OK good. The future is looking less horrible already. What about the unsettling reports of submersible vehicles surfacing in the harbor? There've been no attacks but I want a way to track these things.
I have an idea for that. I modeled it based on the natural abilities of certain mammalian aquatic life. You see they send out high-pitched sound waves that they can—
I think we'll stick with Sonar.
Radar Repair Kits are ready LT.
What about you Floyd? We're all waiting on you now! Also, what do you call this thing?
Seriously, that's just horrible. What about...Sound-Radar? Sound-Dar?
Keep scanning, ensign. Those brigands are bound to be here somewhere. They were spotted surfacing only a few minutes ago. They can't have gotten far.
Lieutenant! Nice of you to join us. Nothing yet, but we have narrowed down the search area…
There they are! Now quickly! To the ships before they can escape!
I hope they like depth charges.
After the defeat we just handed them, I doubt they'll want more.
Those guys may have been there for a while. Who knows what kind of intel they were able to get from us.
Anything they gathered is now resting at the bottom of the harbor. At least Floyd's "Sonar" should help us track any future incursions.
We should also begin regular patrols of our own subs in the area. I want to know  as soon as these guys come back.
Sir? I've been tracking something odd showing up on radar. It looks like one of the islands is adrift and floating this way?
Wait, wait, wait. I'm no… islandologist… but I don't think islands work like that.
Lieutenant Morgan is right, Perkins. That doesn't make any sense, but that is one huge blip. We should send out the fleet to find out whatever that thing is.
I don't like this, Morgan. This doesn't feel right.
What's the worst it could be?
OK, so that's WAY worse than I thought it would be. How does that much metal not sink straight to the bottom of the ocean anyway?
I'm not sure Lieutenant, but I think we should help it find its way down there.
That's the spirit, Sergeant! Pike? Got any ideas on how to defeat this thing?
This is going to take every bit of sea-faring battle knowledge and cunning that I possess.
Wow. Facing down impossible odds should be a joyous occasion.
I'd heard rumors of the Dreadnaught class ships while I was still in the service, but I never expected to actually see one. I think I need to go lie down.
C'mon Pike! We did it! The immediate crisis and our imminent destruction have been postponed! Probably for a while!
I'm sorry Lieutenant, I just don't share your enthusiasm. The Sovereign Navy will be back. They won't take this well. I know. I used to be one of them.
I need EVERYONE in here RIGHT NOW to address this serious problem! This affects us all!
OK Morgan, we're all here! What's the terrible issue we must deal with?
I thought I had a few more days left, but it finally happened. We need to send a fleet of ships down to Pike's Port City and ask for help IMMEDIATELY.
They just got a shipment of limited edition Rum Runner's Rum and I hear it's delish!
Hey! This is serious! Did I mention it's limited?!
Well sir, the barrels have been built and we even carved out some space in some of the ships for those secret compartments you requested.
The last thing I want is for my precious cargo to be pilfered by some Reef Bandits or something like that. You can't be too cautious in situations like this.
Your approach to this situation was highly inappropriate, Morgan. You scared the daylights out of us! Perkins was soaked in tears!
All ships ready? Let's get this over with as quickly and as soberly as possible.
Captain Pike is going to help you sir, no problem. I really think—
Dammit Perkins! Make this thing go faster! Blow on the sails or something!
And radio ahead! I don't want to stay too long.
You know why I'm here, Pike. Don't make me beg.
Of course Lieutenant Morgan! I'm more than happy to help. I've been in your situation before and it's not one I want to be in again.
Now, I understand you're more of a whiskey man, but I can offer you the finest rum you've ever tasted!
Just put it in the barrels Pike. Slowly. No sudden moves. We're both getting something we want. Let's not make a big deal out of this.
There's just the matter of payment and you'll be on your way.
One day, I'm going to talk to her…
It was wonderful doing business with you, Lieutenant! You and your men are welcome any time.
Can we stay for a bit sir? I'd like to get to know some of the—
Everyone! We're leaving! Perkins, deal with your crush on the translator on your own time. I've got important military drinking, er, thinking to do.
Sir, do you really think it was necessary to bring so many ships? Don't we run the risk of attracting unwanted attention?
Think about it, Ramsey. We're transporting precious cargo across dangerous waters. I'm not about to risk anything. Besides who's gonna mess with this many ships?
Sirs! We have Sovereign ships incoming!
Finally! Some concern for the cargo!
Ramsey, don't look at me like that. You were right, OK. It's called humility.
We survived, didn't we? With minimal casualties?
I'm just glad your alcohol is safe, sir.
Sir? I don't think most of us Imperials were built for this sea travel stuff. So much… up and down…
Yeah, some of you guys look absolutely terrible. Tell you what. You go over there, away from me, hang your head over the side of the boat and let loose.
Perkins isn't the only one affected by this, Morgan. We should look for a better solution. Maybe those Reef Bandits have a way of dealing with this.
Alright? Let's grab that translator for this.
Well, that was fun. I'm guessing that was the welcoming committee?
From what I've been able to gather, there are two factions of Reef Bandits. That must have been the… more aggressive group.
There's a friendlier looking group on that beach. I'll go ask if they can help you Imperials out.
They found the very notion of becoming sick by the motion of the sea laughable but they did offer some suggestions. I wrote them down in this list.
Hmm, this looks like nothing more than a recipe for some vegetable soup? Am I missing something?
Please, let me try it out sir. It's awful out there.
Man, now I'm hungry for soup.
I got the vegetables and made a big pot of soup with them. It smells delicious on land. I hope this works at sea.
Alright, let's get this over with.
Should I eat the soup now or wait until we're out over the water?
I'm guessing now? Like one of those pills for allergies. It probably has some sort of vegetable time release thing going on.
How are you feeling, Perkins? You still look fairly green…
Ugh, now I feel full and nauseous, sir. It's even worse than before.
Alright, well, since this was an utter failure and Perkins is curled in the fetal position next to a bucket, we should probably head back in to shore.
We have enemy ships incoming sir. Look like Sovereign ships.
Wonderful. Hold on Perkins! Your nausea is going to be over soon, one way or another.
Huh, who knew it would be that simple?
Lieutenant, the men spotted this box floating among the debris from the enemy ships. It's labeled "Motion Sickness Pills".
Well, that could be handy. At the very least we should be able to have Floyd reverse-engineer something from it. What are the ingredients?
Lt. Morgan? I've noticed a growing problem that should be addressed soon but I need your permission to proceed.
What is it this time, Perkins? Are we out of ham? Is there a shortage of tube socks?
No sir. There are a lot of ships running aground at night near the Outpost so I thought we should build one of those giant shore night lights as a warning.
It's called a Lighthouse Perkins, and I've already come up with a design I think is both cost effective and efficient.
Permission granted for the "giant shore night light".
Meh. You win some, you get blinded by others.
Perkins! Front and center! I need an update on that giant flashlight.
Ships crashing into the shore because of the dark are down 85%! Ships crashing into the shore because of being blinded by the light are up 100% though…
I bet we could find some useful military equipment on the seafloor after all those ships sunk. No point for it to go to waste.

Hmm, we already have some diving gear and we could use some of the fishing nets to carry objects, but we'd need some sort of large crane to haul the "useful military equipment", as you called it, out of the water.
I got this, LT. I could rig up somethin' simple with a crane and some pontoons to float it on.
Does Perkins know how to swim? I guess we'll find out.
We wouldn't want to go and have to salvage our salvage crane!
Well it turns out Perkins CAN swim, just not very well while wearing a hundred pounds of diving gear. Good thing we had that rope attached to him. I call it a successful test run.
Ok, I guess? It'll float for sure but I may need to tone down the acceleration of the on-board motor. The whole structure's a bit top-heavy.
Morgan, it seems some scruffy looking looters have moved in on our salvage area.
Wait, what? They're going after OUR stuff? I won't stand for this! We have looters rights!
Floyd, you're a learned man. Don't you know about Maritime Law and salvage rights or something?
I'm more of an amateur enthusiast on Bird Law, but I do believe we're within our rights to defend our claim.
Those guys are going down! Then we'll salvage their salvage they salvaged from us.
Those guys had crappy looking boats. No wonder they want our stuff.
We sunk or scared away all the scavengers, Lieutenant. Should we go after any of the stragglers?
No Sergeant, let them run. Just keep an eye out for more in case they show up again.
Lt. Morgan sir? Sovereign ships have been sighted in the area. Again.
Man, these guys are relentless. How many times do we have to kick their butts before they leave us alone?
Looks like they're being escorted by submarines Lieutenant. We should take care of this while we know their location.
Alright Sergeant. Permission to engage granted.
Why do they keep coming up here anyway?
We could totally get to it if all that water wasn't in the way.
And another victory for Imperial forces. Well done everyone.
Wait. Did one of those subs not explode?
I saw the same thing, Morgan. Looks like they scuttled it.

OK, so, the abandoned sub is just sitting there on the seafloor and we can't get to it. Tying weights to Perkins' feet and lowering him down to the sub almost worked but I think we'll need a better solution.
Why don't we use one of them divin' suits? That way he'll be able to breathe and not pass out like last time?
I also recommend constructing a decompression chamber. Going that far down and then coming back up too quickly is highly dangerous. Potentially separating the nitrogen from—
Alright, permission granted to build those things. Just stop with the constant explanations, OK Floyd?
We all know you're smart, jeeze.
The decompression chamber is complete and functioning. We can now safely send Perkins down as far as he'll go before being crushed by the sheer amount of water above him.
Good stuff. We'll have to test those limits later. What about you Zoey?
The diving gear is ready to go LT! I even had enough time to attach this flamethrower to the left arm of the suit!
Hey! What the hell are those Reef Bandits doing near our stuff?
They're scavengers Lieutenant. This is what they do. We can't really blame them for that, can we?
I can! Let 'em scavenge their own ships from the bottom of the ocean. I want that sub.
Hey Reef Bandits! We'll give you something to scavenge!
Can I get a flashlight or something? It's dark down there.
Well, now that all the distractions are out of the way, let's get this salvage operation going. I wanna see that sub as soon as humanly possible!
Yes sir, I'm still wearing the diving suit as you instructed me to. Did you know the helmet is bullet-proof? I do, now.
Alright Perkins, let's get you into the water. Just like last time except this time you've got some oxygen!
The sub's been hauled up, mostly intact too! Looks like there's only some minor damage. Oughtta be pretty easy to fix it up.
Interesting. I wonder why it was abandoned if it was mostly functional? All the Sovereign guys are either gone or dead, right?
Yes Morgan, it appears that way. I'll do a thorough inspection of the interior to see what I can find.
Don't be a trap, don't be a trap...
Everyone makes mistakes from time to time.
Alright Floyd, what's the word? Is it a trap? I'm really hoping for some good news from all of this.
Not that I can tell, Morgan. It appears as if the hatch wasn't properly secured and our attacks were able to jostle it open, flooding the interior.
Wow, that sounds lucky for us. I guess in the end, we're all just people huh?

After consulting with Captain Pike, we'll need a building to properly build naval ships. It sounds like we'll need many ships in the near future. Both for protection and for ferrying supplies to Pike.

OK, let's get started then. A few days ago I was happily ignorant of the fact that people would bother crossing that much water and now I've been told that there's a hostile nation that wants our entire continent.
The Dry Dock can be found in the Build menu under the Military category.
To be known as the place that launched a thousand ships!
So, you don't build the ships directly in the water? I'm just saying, with how big some of these boats are, I'm not going to help you carry them to the water.
That's the whole purpose of this facility, Morgan! Build them out of the water, where it's dry, then lower them in. Nobody will have to carry anything.
I'm not sure it works that way, Floyd.
Scouts have reported some enemy ships on the horizon Lieutenant. It looks like they're searching for something. Probably Pike and his men.
Alright Ramsey. I guess now's as good a time as any to test out our water wings? Sea legs? You know what I mean.
If you'll allow me to accompany your men I could be of assistance. You may know how to fight on the land but I know a thing or two about sea warfare.
… Permission granted, but I get all the credit if things go well since it was my decision to allow you to go along.
Morgan can be really generous sometimes.
There will be many more battles. I guarantee it.
Yep, I knew we would win. If Imperials are good at anything it's war. I don't care what's under your feet.
I can't help it sir. This constant up and down motion, it's like the worst roller-coaster I've ever been on.
I can't remember the last time I was nauseous. Just one more thing about me that's so impressive.
LT, these boat repair kits ain't gonna cut it for much longer. Luckily I came up with some plans of my own on how to repair these boats in a massive facility.
Hmm, like a boat hospital? I tell you what. You remove these scribbles about "Automated Sentry Drones" and I'll let you have at it. I hate robots.
You can find the Ship Repair Bay in the Military category!
All done, LT! Now we can repair our boats without havin' to make those repair kits.
Excellent work, Zoey. I trust you also removed that extra bit we talked about? The robots?
Yeah, LT. I'm gonna sneak 'em past you one of these days though!
The ships we've faced so far have been mere scouts. After losing this many men I expect the leadership to start sending their more serious firepower soon.
Floyd an' me came up with some plans for some boats of our own with REAL firepower that we gotta get buildin' LT.
Zoey, I see that twinkle in your eye that usually means something is about to go horribly wrong, or horribly right. Either way, I'm going to stay away from the beach for the time being.
You can build the new ships at the Dry Dock.
Excellent! Your Imperial craftsmanship seems more than sea-worthy. I'm beginning to feel as if death is no longer imminent for us!
You're sounding more like an Imperial every day Pike.
I might have found that offensive at first, but not so much anymore. I get the feeling your Lieutenant Morgan isn't very fond of me though.
Don't take it personal. You know more about sea warfare than he does and he's just a bit intimidated by that is all. Well, that and the fact that you brought a new, deadly enemy to our doorstep.
Floyd you like collecting things, right?
I've been known to dabble in the collection and categorization of certain items from time to—
That's great. You see this list? I want you to gather up all these materials. Pike needs these supplies for his colony and since he gave the list to me, I'm pushing it off on you.
I had several activities planned for this afternoon, but I suppose that will have to wait.
Just go get the stuff, Floyd.
Follow Floyd and help load all of the stuff he's going to show you onto some of the ships. We need to take it down to Pike. Don't eat all the cabbage!
Hmmm, that appears to be… Yep. Warships. At the Outpost. Well that's just swell.
Ramsey! I need you to deal with this threat immediately. Nobody threatens an Imperial Outpost! Take Pike with you.
On it, Lieutenant. Pike! You're with me.
We shall lead our forces to victory, Sergeant! Then I believe a celebratory drink will be in order.
It's like Morgan has a twin.

The rate at which you Imperials can adapt to new situations is truly remarkable. I mean, just a short time ago you had no seafaring experience and now you have added another victory against the world's foremost naval force.
I was extremely lucky to make it to your Outpost.
Yeah, it's true. We are pretty great. Well, as long as it involves war.
Now that I have you here, Lieutenant, I have a favor to ask of you. Well more specifically Karin, our translator, has a favor. I'll let her explain.

Mr. Morgan? I was wondering if you and your military guys would help me make non-confrontational contact with the indigenous population we call the Reef Bandits? See, I want to establish communications between us.
It's Lieutenant, by the way. I worked very hard to achieve this rank, young lady. Why do you want to talk to those guys? They just seem like your typical displaced peoples. Violent and angry.
That's exactly my point Lieutenant! It's partly our fault they're in this situation! I want to help if I can. Also the fact that it's a new language for me to learn! So exciting!
Well you definitely seem enthusiastic. Ramsey! We're moving out! Perkins! Help Karin with her stuff.
So, Karin? Have I introduced myself yet?
OK sir, I see them, and they see us too!
We usually find them in this area on a pretty regular basis. We think they use it as their fishing area.
Perkins. Scout around the area, let me know if you see anything.
Um, sir? How exactly am I supposed to "scout around" while aboard a ship?
I don't know, climb something! Something really tall. Don't fall off!
Reef Bandits have spotted us sir! They're coming this way!
Boda! Boda fen fen cho! Tuko mo lassy gren di waul! Ri lo hauny!
Karin? What's this guy yelling about? He seems super pissed and I don't like it when I'm being yelled at by people waving knives and fishing poles!
I… I'm trying… Something about attacking? I think they're going to attack us. We've disturbed their "hunting grounds"...?
Man, this guy isn't letting up. Alright I've had enough. Ramsey! Take 'em out!
OK, I think I got the basics.
Well, they certainly are a lot quieter after they've been shot a few times. Can you make any sense of their language yet Karin? We're kind of counting on you here.
I'm trying Lieutenant Morgan. It's very different from other languages I've encountered.
Well, make it quick, will you? Most of these guys aren't dead and avoiding another fight would be awesome.
So, yeah, when I said they were going to attack? Yeah, it turns out they were just upset that we disturbed the hunting grounds of a local predator. That predator is the one who's going to attack.
Yeah. I kind of screwed that one up. Sorry.
About that predator thing you were talking about? Is that going to attack us? Why am I asking, of course it is.
Yeah, it's that big thing in the water...
Well, that was horrible. New rule everybody! We establish communications with a people BEFORE we give the order to fire. I want to know that they're actually trying to kill us first.
Unless they shoot at us. Then it's self explanatory.
Boda! Nos da asche?! Tuko mo dern fen da clak clak! Grota na mabels tac tac!
The, uh, Chief here is upset that you guys destroyed a lot of their fishing gear during that little scuffle earlier. He's demanding compensation. I think.
Oh, well that should be easy to remedy.
Meh, I still chalk this one up as a win.
Alright Chief, we decided to do the right thing and got some stuff together for you. We're sorry for breaking your things and shooting your guys.
Ay, sankk na mimmo. O dem kiki verg. Chos...
The Chief thanks you for your, as he called it, "effort".
Sir? I got a message from Karin. She has some important news for us and wants us to meet her and the Reef Bandit Chief at the Fishing Grounds.
She also said we should bring some sort of gift for the Reef Bandits.
Like what? Some veggies or something? Also, Ramsey? What are the odds this is a trap?
I don't see that being likely here, sir. Perkins' girlfriend doesn't strike me as the devious type.
Well, we wouldn't want to make this too easy would we?
Wada ferm de fen fen chos. Boka di creen alm fa shope.
OK Chief. O'n tronbo fem gro.
The Chief says that as long as you both steer clear of each other they won't attack you if you give them the same courtesy.
Seems reasonable. I can agree to those terms.
He also said that you may encounter other hostile groups that he doesn't control.
Sir? We've received a message from Captain Pike. He wants to set up a trade route between The Outpost and his city.
Huh, that's odd. I'm used to having the people we contact try to sever all connection with us, not encourage further partnership. I wonder what the catch is.
We both have common goals Morgan. It's not a bad thing to have allies.
He then goes on to say that the route is currently too dangerous and needs our help to secure it.
You guys better order lots of expensive stuff.
Well Pike, I hope you're satisfied. We once again risked our boats to get here, but the path should be clear for the time being.
This is going to be a net-positive for both of us Lieutenant, you'll see! Sure it may be a little difficult at first but us, working together, it's going to be glorious!
You do realize we have other things going on right? Deadly Rebels, murderous Raiders, and those Silver Wolf jerks. We can't be spending all our time splashing around in the water with you.
We've received our first orders from Port City. Simple tools and such. Nothing too fancy.
Kind of an underwhelming first order, isn't it? Tools are boring, Floyd. Where's the pizazz? The flash?
You've entered the exciting world of trade, Morgan! Give it some time. Not every order is going to be for a death-ray or large amount of explosives.
Wait, you have a death-ray you're holding out on me?
Don't think I forgot about that death-ray either...
Everything has been loaded up, sirs. The first order is ready to launch as soon as you give the word.
I mean, I guess I understand the need for some basic, boring stuff, but not even a little weapons cache on the side? Just for fun?
It's about building up infrastructure, Morgan. Necessities before luxuries!
Hey Perkins! Any word from Port City? It feels like things have been quiet lately.
Yes sir, we received a message this morning. Their production is a little slower than they want and would like some help if we can offer it.
Uh, I guess we can help? I've got nothing better going on right now anyway.
Can we charge him for the boat mileage? Is that a thing?
Wait, what the hell just happened?
We appreciate the assistance Lieutenant. It's important to have allies in tough times such as these.
Know that any time you or other Imperials need our help, we'll be there.
Yeah, yeah, no problem. Helping is its own reward and all that. So, about compensation…
Oh don't worry about that! You don't owe us a thing. We'll consider it a gift. Now if you'll excuse me, I have some important matters to attend to.
It's been happening more and more frequently Lieutenant. Those Reef Bandits keep picking off our ships along the trade route. We need a show of force, sir.
Alright Ramsey, I'm open to suggestions. What do you propose?
Armed escort, sir. We send down some of our war ships with the next shipment. Show those Bandits that you lose when you mess with Imperials.
Sounds like a solid plan. I'll come along as well. You never know when you'll need a military genius with you.
Imperials! Get ready to move out!
Someone get Perkins the training manual.
We took care of the enemy ships and were able to keep all of our cargo ships afloat. We shouldn't have any other obstacles on our way to Port City.
Excellent news Ramsey. Now I think the time is right for some on-ship entertainment. Perkins! Entertainment Routine Alpha!
I keep telling you sir, I don't know what that is!
Port City is in sight, sir! It looks like Captain Pike is waiting at the dock. He looks concerned about something.
Oh great. He better be waiting to give us all kinds of praise for saving his cargo.
Perkins, look less green. That's an order.
I just want off this boat...
Well, here we are again. Braving troubled waters to ensure safe passage for the cargo ships. We should really get a medal.
It's nice to see you too, Lieutenant. As always, we appreciate your assistance. Please join me for a drink if you would.
Well, if you insist. It was a long and treacherous journey after all.
Zoooooeeeey! We're booorrrrrred! Will you take us to the beach? We wanna search for buried treasure!
I ain't sure how much buried treasure there is out there, but we can check. Let me get a couple things together for ya.
Wow, Zoey! These metal detectors are awesome! The blinky lights are so cool looking!
Yeah, they do look pretty cool. You kids ready to have some fun at the beach? I'm gonna keep an eye on y'all from this hut.
Zoey! We found something! This is the coolest looking treasure chest I've ever seen! I wonder what's inside it…
Whoa there, kids! That ain't no treasure chest at all. That's an explosive mine. Must'a washed ashore.
That's even cooler! But ... how do we play with it?
Oh, that parts simple. We're gonna blow it up! It'd be dangerous to just leave it here.
Oh, alright then. I'm going back to bed.
What's all the commotion out here? I was trying to instruct Perkins on the proper way to fold my tube socks when we were interrupted by a giant explosion.
That was us, LT. The kids found a mine that got washed ashore. We blew it up. For safety.
Zoey? Did you guys bury some metal pipes in the ground near the beach? This definitely doesn't look like a treasure chest…
What in the heck are you kids talkin' bout now?
OH! Yeah, guys, you should move away from that before you wake it up…
Oh no! It's moving! What happened?
Ok fine, but you have to bring a full platoon with you next time.
First, large explosions! Then, you find robot monsters and somehow activate them!
I'm not usually one to put my foot down, but you kids are officially banned from playing on this beach. I don't know if the Outpost can take much more.
But! We didn't mean to! It was an accident!
Yeah, LT. They didn't mean nuthin' by it. It's a good thing they found this stuff when they did. What if those things woke up when we were all sleepin'?
Lieutenant Morgan, sir? The Reef Bandit Chief is on the radio again, but I can't make out what he wants. Permission to contact Karin to help translate?
I can't take it anymore, Floyd! I'm tired of relying on others for simple things like communicating with other people. I don't wanna do it anymore.
What in the blazes are you vociferating about now?
I want you to build me some sort of machine that will translate whatever sounds those Reef Bandits are making into speech that I can understand!
I'm going to ignore the fact that this probably isn't possible with the materials I have available, and trudge on regardless. I may require Zoey's help with this.
So, it'll be ready by Tuesday?
Sir? Should I still contact Karin?
All done, LT! Golly, that contraption was a tall order, but I think we worked it out. You should'a seen how big the first one was!
Man, this thing is huge. Will it actually translate the Reef Bandits' language? It's not going to explode, is it?
It should work as intended. Now, granted, computing technology is still somewhat basic, but we managed to get this machine down to a respectable size.

Floyd, Zoey, I want you two to figure out a way to get this behemoth to the Reef Bandit Chief. We can't keep it here. The Reef Bandits never visit and it totally contrasts with the motif we've got going on.
This thing might sink one of our boats if we load it on one. I reckon a little extra float's gonna be necessary.
Good idea, Zoey. I'll see what we can do about that.
Yeah, you guys go do that. I'll be here.
Yeah, well it smells like fish parts.
This thing stinks, Floyd. Why does this giant computer thing of yours smell so bad?
I ran into a problem where the main circuits would overheat too easily and current methods of drawing the heat out were insufficient. I had to utilize a… less than conventional method.
Um, LT? Did you feel that? Like somethin' brushed up against the boat?
No, but admittedly, I wasn't feeling very hard. Let me try a bit harder…
OK, I felt that one. Ramsey! Get the men ready for a fight! I think we're going to have company soon.
Alright Floyd. What exactly did you fill this thing with? Why is it attracting giant Groupers? What did you do?

Well, your "fish parts" comment wasn't too far off. I've found that if you indiscriminately throw multiple types of aquatic life into a big vat and make a slurry out of it, the slurry has all sorts of applications.
Hello, Chief! We bring you a great gift! This giant contraption can translate our words so we can understand each other! Don't worry about the smell.
.... Floyd, why isn't the machine working?
Oh yes! Uh, we need to plug it in… somewhere. Does anyone see a power outlet?
Well, I'm embarrassed. You really outdid yourself this time, Floyd. Let's get this piece of junk out of here and go home.
But it works! I assure you, it does!
Uh, Lieutenant Morgan, sir? I've been monitoring radio chatter in the area and managed to pick up some Sovereign signals. They've heard about the translator and they want it pretty bad.
So, they're going to attack us then? And soon, I'm guessing?
Yes sir. I think that's them on the horizon, actually.
I'm blaming you for this, Floyd!
Alright, I'm done with this thing. Melt it down. Scrap it, get rid of it. I hate it and its fishy smell and, I don't want to see any part of it ever again.
Destroying this machine would be a huge injustice, Morgan. The circuitry inside is highly sophisticated and a great feat of modern engineering.
Alright Floyd, I hear you. I won't make you destroy it. Zoey! Destroy this thing.
Look everyone! Perkins is back from his date with Karin!
Uh, it wasn't a date, actually. She made that very clear. But oh! We saw something incredible!
We visited the Reef Bandits for some research she was doing and they had these Groupers trained to do all sorts of things! Even fight for them!
Wait, wait, wait. They trained Groupers to fight for them? And it worked? We should totally do that!
Hey Floyd! We're gonna need some stuff to catch some Groupers.
I'll take your word for it.
I don't know much about fishing nets, Floyd, but these look super sturdy. Are you sure they'll be able to hold a Grouper?
Indeed, it should be no problem. The trick was to be extra encouraging when weaving the fibers.
Just think, Floyd. Wave after wave of emotionless aquatic killers at our disposal! The Sovereign won't know what hit 'em.
Your statement seems a little premature, Morgan. We haven't even captured one yet. Let alone built a facility—
Jeeze Floyd, can't you ever just bask in the glow of a good idea? Why do you always have to kill the mood with talk of "plans" and thinking ahead?
Since when is appropriate planning a mood killer?
Uh, can I at least get a hose or something?
Baby Groupers captured and stowed safely on board, sir!
Perfect! Keep 'em moist, Perkins. I don't want these things drying out and dying before we get home. Grouper jerky doesn't sound very appetizing.
Sir? We need to get these fish off the boat and into an aquarium or something. They're not looking too good after that trip.
I hear you, Perkins. Floyd, did you hear that? We need a giant water tank to put these fish into. Hop to it.
I'll build your facility but keep in mind, I'm not formally a member of your military. You can't just throw orders at me like one of your soldiers.
Get a move on, Floyd! The fish could die!
They're more machine now than beast. Well, besides all the organic matter.
These fish are pretty smart after bein' all trained up. I named the fat one "Fatty" and the skinny one "Scrappy".
You probably shouldn't be naming these things, Zoey. I don't want you getting too attached, y'know?
He's right, Zoey. These are tools of war now. Any shred of animality they once had has been ripped out and replaced with military commands.
Y'know Perkins, I'm THIS CLOSE to finishing my crossword puzzle. Do you have the answer to 4 Across? Because if not—
No sir, it's just that our harbor patrols have reported some large Groupers in the water near the Outpost. Almost like they're searching for something.
What would Groupers be searching for around our … oh.
Well Morgan, I hope you've learned a valuable lesson from all of this.
Yep, totally. From now on, we only use orphans. No parents to get in the way.

I've received word from Pike, sir. The Sovereign forces... they've all been destroyed. Someone, or something wiped them out after they used that key stolen from the Reef Bandits to open that ancient vault.
This could be really bad, Lieutenant. Anything strong enough to take out a group that tough is gonna be trouble. Whatever it is could be headed towards innocent people right now.
Alright, calm down! We don't even know what happened yet. First, we need to head out there and see what we can figure out about all of this.
I mean, it's not like investigating this type of thing ever goes wrong for us, right?
Ok, we're here, and all I'm seeing is a bunch of formerly Sovereign shaped debris. Anyone see what's responsible? I think we owe them a fresh batch of cookies.
Sir? Am I the only one seeing a giant red-ish island thing moving slowly this way?
Oh crap. This is VERY bad.
Man your battlestations! This is NOT a drill!
I know, right? I wonder if there's anything cool we can sell in that vault it came out of.
Victims of their own hubris. Those poor Sovereign bastards never stood a chance.
What the hell, Pike? When did you get here? And how the hell did you get onto my ship without me seeing?

The sounds of battle were easy enough to follow after you'd engaged that horrid beast unleashed by the Sovereign. We knew where the Sovereign forces had been defeated. We just had to wait for you and your men.
Oh yeah. Things got pretty loud for a while there. Did you see us kick its ass?
Yes, Lieutenant. It was very impressive.
Lieutenant, some of the men are getting anxious being stuck on the ships for so long. They want some leave time to blow off some steam.
That seems like a decent enough idea, but those rags you're currently wearing aren't gonna cut it.
Rags? But these are standard issue Imperial battle garments.
Ah! Much better! Now you'll no longer be an embarrassment to the entire Outpost!
I thought I liked the way I looked, but I have to admit, this new uniform gives me a certain…confidence I didn't have before.
Oh, I'm making Perkins go with you. I can't think of a reasonable excuse why right now. Mainly it's to get him away from me.

Everyone listen up! We've got limited time to spend in Port City so I'm going to lay down some ground rules. First, represent the Empire with dignity and respect. If someone challenges you to a drinking contest, you gotta do it.
Second, Imperials never back down. If someone tries to start something with you, lay 'em out.
Um, Sergeant? I don't know if these are the best rules to be following when we're away from the Outpost. Things could get out of hand.
This brings me to rule number three. Direct all authority figures to Perkins if you get into any trouble. He'll take care of it.
Oh, that part was completely serious.
Things are going smoother than I thought they would. I'm having a pretty fun time so far!
Great. We might as well enjoy ourselves while we're here. And listen, I was just giving you a hard time with those rules earlier. I just wanted to wind you up a bit.
Oh good! I was worried you were serious about the drinking contests and the fighting.
Um, Sergeant Ramsey? Maybe you should let the locals win this round? They're starting to get a bit upset…
…*hic* Don't worry about it, Per… Purrface? Hahaha! You're not a cat…
Oh man, you're looking a little worse for wear, sir. I think we should get out of here before anything—
HA! You losers! I win again! Kiss my behind!
How'd my new uniform get all messed up?
I was a little out of it there for a minute. Guess I just needed a little adrenaline to get me going again.
Well, we survived, so I guess that's a plus.
Oh, my head. I think I've done enough drinking and fighting for a while.
Welcome back! Wow, you guys look terrible. Anyone wanna have a drink with me?
I just got word from our cargo ships that your latest rum shipment from Port City was attacked by a giant Grouper near the trade route.
What! My rum's gone?! We MUST find this giant fish. I will not rest until I bring the damned thing to justice!
Uh, sir? Are you alright? You've got this REALLY intense look in your eyes and it's kind of unsettling.
I have been wounded. It's like I'm missing a leg.
OK, I just finished processing what I said to you and your concerns may be valid.
All that stuff you asked for has been loaded onto some of the ships, Lieutenant. I gotta caution you though, sir. Don't let this become an obsession. It's not healthy.
Ramsey, relax. When have I ever taken things too far? I'm just going to go after this fish, come hell or high water, possibly dying in the process…
No sign of the alleged Grouper yet, sir.
So, it's going to be like that, is it? Alright, fine. Take out the next Groupers you see. We'll draw him out.
This feels unethical, but Floyd did say these things are jerks so...
I hate the smell of Grouper chow in the morning...
Still no sign of it, sir. Should we head back to the Outpost?
Head back? We haven't even seen the thing yet! Just continue chumming the water with that Grouper chow. It'll show up. I can feel it.
The monster has been sighted, sir! Off our port side!
Bring us around, helmsman! This giant beast is going to pay for destroying that shipment of perfectly good liquor!
You're not getting away from me, BEAST!
It's down, sir. You've accomplished your goal.
I was really hoping for a more satisfying ending here. I mean, we didn't even get its life story. We know he destroys things, but why? Parental issues? Lust for gold? These are the deep questions.
Why would a fish want gold?
This situation must be dealt with, Lieutenant. My city has been under siege by a new class of submarine we've never seen before. And we're not the only settlement to have been attacked either.
Look, Pike, I'm all for keeping the waters safe, and yeah, I've been getting some similar reports. But our equipment hasn't been able to pick anything up yet. We can't attack what we can't find.
About that, LT. I been thinkin' about ways to make Floyd's sonar a bit more sensitive. I 'spose I could fix it up a bit.
Why does that make me nervous?
So, what exactly does this thing do, Zoey?
Well, the sonar machine normally blasts out sound waves, then listens for the echo of the sound waves after they bounce offa sumthin'. Well, it enhances that and makes it do a better job.
It's working, sir! We've spotted the enemy subs on the sonar. Whatever Zoey did is working!
Once again, we've been helped by the unexplainable magics of Science! It really is capable of miracles in the proper hands.
What about in the improper hands?
Yes, I leave all secret plans just laying around.
OK, those looked like the same old subs we've been facing. Pike? I thought you said there was a new type of sub showing up. Did you hear about them while still a Sovereign or something?
Nothing official, no, but keep in mind that was several years ago. I know what I saw, Lieutenant. They've obviously developed some new technology since then.
Damn, I was hoping you had some secret construction plans laying around that we could use to make our own.
Hey LT! I got an idea you might wanna know about for how ta keep them new submarines away from the Outpost.
Zoey, you're by far my most valuable asset at this entire Outpost, and I appreciate anything you can do to strategically enhance our place in this world.
Now, having said that, I can tell you that most of what you do scares the crap out of me. Is this improvement you're talking about going to be dangerous?
Not ta us, no. Only the people in the subs near our Outpost.
Or any animals in the water. Pretty much anythin' in the water.
Zoey, great job taking something that Floyd cobbled together and making it more useful. That's the kind of thing I like to see.

I've just inspected the "enhancements" Zoey added to my sonar device and I must say it is truly appalling! Anything in the water remotely near our Outpost is either going to go deaf or be driven mad from the noise!
Wow … that sounds ... pretty amazing actually. Well done, Zoey.
This can't be right. Zoey! Get in here! Why am I seeing a whole bunch of fancy looking subs in the bay near the Outpost? I thought your enhancements were supposed to keep these things away?
Well, it is supposed to do that… I don't understand what's goin' on.
I believe I can help. After further examination of Zoey's enhancements I've concluded that the machine does not have an ample power supply to act in the manner for which—
It's currently acting more like a beacon. An underwater lighthouse, if you will. Telling everyone in the area exactly where we are.
I mean, look at Perkins! He messes up all the time and he's still here.
I trust you believe me about the new type of submarines now, Lieutenant?
Yeah, Pike. Seeing is believing. I saw and now I believe.
Zoey? Please turn off that signal beacon of yours. I'd rather not have to fight more of those things for a while.
Sure thing, LT. I'm real sorry 'bout all the trouble I caused.
Zoey, I still have faith in you and your abilities. We all make mistakes from time to time.

Hey Floyd, I had a thought. We have too many enemies around here. I bet if we gave the Reef Bandits some super nice gifts they'd want to form an alliance! Then we can focus on just the Sovereign trying to kill us!
And what, exactly, are you going to give them to win them over?
Leave that to me, Floyd. If there's one thing I know after years of slaughtering countless indigenous peoples, it's what they want.
I'm guessing "not being slaughtered" isn't on that list?
I want no part in this.
There we go! Nobody could stay mad at us after we give them such generous gifts!

This is perhaps the most insulting set of gifts I've ever seen, Morgan, which is really saying something considering it's coming from you. "Sorry you lost your home. Have some beads and scratchy blankets."
I'm not sure I know what you mean by that. Did you feel those blankets? Super soft.
Lieutenant Morgan, sir? That package you sent to the Reef Bandits came back with this note attached. The box looks like it's been kicked a bunch, too.
Oh man, these blankets have been practically kicked apart, and the beads are all scuffed up. What does the note say? Can you even read it?

Yes sir, I had Karin help me translate it over the radio. It basically says that your gift was terrible and insulting. If you want to send anything, they need clean water and food and safety more than anything else.
If looks could wound, I'd probably have another facial scar.
Alright, Chief. We got you something you actually want this time. I hope you enjoy it.
Lieutenant Morgan, sir! We just received word from the Reef Bandits that your second gift attempt was a huge success!  Especially the bacon!
This is a surprise to no one. Bacon is delicious.
They'd like some more, sir. In fact, they asked to have a few boars of their own so they won't have to ask us again.
I guess that's fine. They better pay us this time.
They're so adorable I could eat them!
Perfect! Let's get these delicious future-meals to the Reef Bandits!
Groupers spotted, sir! And they look hungry!
I think the Groupers want some bacon, too.
I've completed my good deed for the day.
Alright, Chief, enjoy your boars. I hope this shows you that we can be pretty cool. We had to fight off a bunch of hostile groupers to get here.
Alright everyone! Let's get out of here!
This is unexpected… and probably not a good sign.
Pike? What are you doing here?
Astute as ever, Lieutenant. It would seem that several of the Reef Bandit colonies in the area have gone completely silent. Not a word from them in some time.
I'd bet the Chief knows what's going on. We should go talk to him.
Oh yeah, sure. We'll just drop whatever it is we're doing and get right on it.
Enda bo teengu. Mafu sot tog tog. Nen no balics.
According to the Chief here, someone or something has been destroying the other Reef Bandit colonies. He hasn't heard what, exactly, as there have been no survivors.
Wow, really? But you Reef Bandits are pretty tough customers. I've seen you in action. Who could be behind this?
We won't know for sure until we can track them down. We should venture to some other colonies and check on their situation.
The Chief's asked us to check out the Fishing Grounds. He said there should be a small group of Reef Bandits there we can ask if they've seen anything worrying.
Let's get a move on then. For all we know they might be under attack right now from whatever took out those other Bandit groups.
We have to help these people.
Then, we go after whoever is behind this.

Other than the ships we just took out, I'm not seeing anyone else. No Reef Bandits, just debris. We're too late. There's no way to tell for sure if it was the Sovereign Navy or if they were just passing through.
This is unacceptable! We need to scour the wreckage. Find some information! Something!
Pike, I know this isn't what you want to hear right now, but we're doing what we can. The best course of action is to check in on the next group we can find. We need to find survivors.
Give me some good news, Perkins.
Uh, I wish I could sir… I'm not able to raise any Reef Bandits on the radio using the frequencies I got from the Chief. It's possible the radios were disabled or broken though.
Possible, but unlikely. We need to visit the Trade Routes. There's a friendly colony there we can talk to that might be able to give us more information.
Hope for the best, prepare for the worst.
I had hoped with my departure from the Sovereign, their search would stop.
Nothing, sirs. Just more debris. It's like the whole place has been wiped out. I think we can say for sure it's the Sovereign Navy though, at this point.
I refuse to believe we're too late. There have to be some survivors.
If there are any survivors, they aren't around here. We need to move on. There's no point in staying here.
The attacks continue, Lieutenant. We can't keep chasing the Sovereign all over the seas, constantly one step behind. There has to be a better solution.
Oh, there is. I've been thinking of a plan but we're going to need help from the Chief and any Reef Bandits he can contact.
The Chief says he's willing to do whatever it takes to get the attacks to stop. Just let him know.
It's simple, really. They want to attack and destroy Reef Bandits, right? Well let's give them a target. First things first. We're gonna need some new boats.
Those are some fine looking killing machines...
You have your boats, Lieutenant. What, may I ask, is the next step in this plan of yours?
One thing at a time, Pike. Give me a moment to admire the new weapons we just built.
Part two of my genius plan involves disguising some of our troops as Reef Bandits while our ships are hidden nearby. When they come to attack, we spring the trap.
This plan is either madness or brilliance. I suppose we won't find out which until it's too late to back out.
Yeah, that's pretty much how all of Morgan's plans end up.
Well, we are going fishing, in a way.
How do the Reef Bandit disguises feel?
Mine's bunching up in uncomfortable places…
I feel like I'm about to go fishing or something.
This next bit is the easy part. We need to sail to one of the Reef Bandit colonies and then we simply wait for them to come to us.

That sounds simple enough, but unfortunately I need to return to my home. I can't leave my city unguarded in case those scoundrels show up. I'll leave Karin with you to help translate. Please keep her safe.
Alright Karin, now that we're here, let the Chief know we're hiding our ships in that alcove over there, then we wait.
The Chief wants to know what you would like him and his men to do in the mean time.
Act normal, do Reef Bandit stuff. Fishing, I guess? I don't know how long this is going to take.
Sir! I've got Captain Pike on the radio! He says it's urgent that he speak to you right away!
Give me that radio, Perkins. Pike? What's the big idea? Do you have any idea what time it is?
Well, yes. It appears to be noon, Lieutenant.
...Yeah, well we're on military time here, so, what do you want?
If you would be so kind, some Reef Bandits have absconded with some of my cargo ships. I need you to track them down for me, and I need the cargo ships intact.
Pirating ships on the open water? Never thought I'd see the day...
Well, if you wanna go the obvious route. Can we borrow Karin?
This doesn't appear to be all that was taken, but I thank you for your quick and decisive action, Lieutenant.
Heh, that's what we're here for, right?
And what's the deal with these Reef Bandits? I thought we were cool now?
That's not something I can answer, Lieutenant. Perhaps the Chief would be of more help?
Alright Chief, what gives? What's with all the high-seas piracy?
Boda bun ten. Ela monot du fan fan. Fan della muny.
The Chief is saying that he's not the boss of all the Reef Bandits, but he says there may be another group with more cargo ships near here.
I guess "Chief" is more of an honorary title?
All this for tea? I should've thrown this junk in the harbor.
This better be the rest of your stuff that was stolen, Pike. Oh, and you can have Karin back now.
It appears the rest of our stolen supplies are here and unbroken, for the most part.
What was so important that we had to go rushing out to secure this stuff anyway?
We've been out of tea for days now! We couldn't go on any longer without it!
Ramsey and Perkins are not very convincing Reef Bandits, Morgan. Maybe it's Perkins' fiery red hair, or that Ramsey is a full head taller than any of the others.
Well, it's not like we're going to be doing a lot of talking with the Sovereign Navy. As long as Pike's old murder buddies show up, it's good enough.
Lieutenant! I see one! He's trying to swim away!
Wow, sir! I was worried for a minute there but we pulled it off!
My plan worked perfectly! Hold your applause, everyone. Form a single file line so you can each praise me individually.
We should scour the debris for surviving Sovereign. We might be able to get some valuable intel if we can find one of them alive.
Name, rank, and serial number. That's all I've gotten from him so far. You're welcome to try, Morgan, but this guy's been trained pretty well.
Spill it, you piece of slime. What's your beef with the Reef Bandits? Why are you and your cronies determined to wipe them out?

Morgan, right? Whispers of you have made it back to the Sovereign Nation. We know what you're capable of. You can't scare me. Didn't that deserter, Pike, tell you what he was doing? We're just here to finish his job.
Is that so? Huh. Ramsey, wrap this guy up and stow him on one of our transport ships. I want to get this guy down to Pike but I don't want him on one of our warships.
This thing sounds important. Let's head back to the Outpost.
You found one alive? That's quite surprising considering the training they're put through.
Can it, Pike. We know there's more to this whole story that you haven't told us about. Now would be a great time to come clean. What were you REALLY doing out here?
You have to understand, Morgan. I was a different man back then. I couldn't possibly fathom the consequences of my actions at the time. I was simply following orders, but that's no excuse.

We were tasked with finding something that the Reef Bandits were protecting. The details of which were never clear, but it's something very powerful. We were to find it at all costs, regardless of what happened to the Bandits.
Lieutenant Morgan, sir? We found some sort of notes on the Sovereign prisoner. It looks like it's coded though. I can't make it out.
Let me see that. Hmm, yep. It's definitely written in code.
Zoey? You're looking at this thing pretty intensely. Do you have some insight?
It looks like somethin' my grampa taught me about when I was young. I loved figurin' out stuff like this. I reckon I could build a device to make sense of it.
Wait, is this why your handwriting is so bad?
I have Captain Pike on the radio, sir.
All done, LT! It weren't too difficult neither. Looks like their next targets are listed here. They're gonna be attackin' these two places at the same time!
Brilliant Zoey! We're finally a step ahead of these guys.
Perkins! Radio Pike and let him know what we found out. This is going to take some coordination.
Alright men. While we protect one group, Pike and his ships are going to protect the other group. I shouldn't have to tell you how important this is.
The Reef Bandits had their homes destroyed, all because of some stupid thing the Sovereign thinks they have. But, we're going to put an end to this careless slaughter. Today we say, "Not this time."
What's luck got to do with it?
We've beaten them, Lieutenant. They put up quite a fight but we won.
Let's hope Pike has similar luck.
We know what we must do. Lieutenant Morgan was generous enough to lend us some of his fleet to protect the Reef Bandits. Let's put these ships to good use.
Captain Pike, sir? Are you ever going to tell the Imperials the rest of the story? I think they deserve to know.
I'll have to before too long. Let's just try to survive this first.
They've all been destroyed. Why does it seem I'm constantly pursued by death and violence? Why can't I just be left in peace?
You know that's not how the world works, Captain. The day you stop fighting is the day you stop living.
Alright, so the Sovereign have been defeated. Let's bring this boat back home for some celebratory drinks.
Well, enemy patrol groups were cleared out sir, but I can see what looks like a makeshift base on the island. Should we go in for a closer look?
A makeshift base? We better go in for a closer look. There could be valuable intel in that place.
Perkins! Put those binoculars away! It's impolite to stare.
Staging area? I don't like the sound of that.
No sir. There doesn't appear to be anything of value here. This must have been a staging area for something else.
Oh dear… Lieutenant Morgan, sir? The uh, the Chief here is saying it's all for naught. The simultaneous attacks were a distraction while the Sovereign sent another fleet to a third location.
We were supposed to decipher that piece of paper, weren't we? Then we would be out of the way while they went after what they really wanted. Where the hell is Pike?
What the hell is this all about? I want the WHOLE truth. Why are all these people dying? What were they protecting?
We need to get to Reef Bandit Camp. I'll explain there.
OK, now I'm a little worried.
The Reef Bandits know the location of an immense power which they've been guarding for many, many years. With the Sovereign in control of it, I'm sorry to say, we are lost. There's nothing we can do.
Wait a second, you're going to have to be a little more specific than just "immense power". What does that even mean?
It means the end of us, Morgan.
Hmm, he wants to see us. Well, me specifically, but I like to travel in groups so you're coming too.
Alright, but is this going to take long?
Alright, Pike. We're here. What was so important that I had to rush down here before finishing my macrame project?
We're more alike than you may realize, Lieutenant. I've committed some truly horrible acts in my lifetime, but the time has come to start making amends. With your help, we can still set things right.
Kinda heavy there, Pike. I usually don't become that introspective until after a drink or two.
